oai_dc:dc.dc:title: L'absorption intestinale des lipides chez la truite arc-en-ciel (Salmo gairdneri )
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vernier, J
Sire, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Salmonidae
Pisces
Lymph
Fatty acids
Nutrition
Lipoproteins
Lipids
Intestines
Food absorption
Metabolism
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Though the absorption of dietary lipids is much slower in S. gairdneri than in mammals, the mechanism does not differ fundamentally. The long chain fatty acids resulting from intraluminal hydrolysis are esterified by the epithelial cells and transferred as VLDL-like particles and chylomicrons to lymph. The size of granules depends on the nature of the ingested fatty acids. The intracellular stages of this lipoprotein synthesis are defined.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Actes de colloques. Ifremer. Brest [ACTES COLLOQ. IFREMER.]. 1985
